trans-unit.source: Provides specific XAML writer settings for <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter"></xref>.
A <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter> can function within specified XamlObjectWriterSettings.

Where settings are not specified, an instance of XamlObjectWriterSettings exists that has default values for a constructed <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter>, and this instance can be used in merges of settings for a derived class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriterSettings"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriterSettings"></xref> class that is based on the copy of an existing instance.
The settings instance to copy.
settings is .
Gets or sets <xref href="System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlAccessLevel"></xref> permissions that the XAML writer observes.
This property indicates the expected access level for non-public members, which are accessed in partial trust through a partial-trust tolerant runtime.
The <xref href="System.Xaml.Permissions.XamlAccessLevel"></xref> permissions.
Gets or sets a reference to a callback that is invoked by the XAML writer at the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize.BeginInit*> phase of the object lifetime for each created object.
A callback that is invoked by the XAML writer at the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize.BeginInit*> phase of object lifetime.
Gets or sets a reference to a callback that is invoked by the XAML writer at the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize.EndInit*> phase of the object lifetime for each created object.
A callback that is invoked by the XAML writer at the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize.EndInit*> phase of object lifetime.
Gets or sets a reference to a callback that is invoked by the XAML writer at the post-member-write phase of the object lifetime for each created object.
A callback that is invoked by the XAML writer at the post-member-write phase of object lifetime.
Gets or sets a reference to a callback that is invoked by the XAML writer at the pre-member-write phase of the object lifetime for each created object.
A callback that is invoked by the XAML writer at the pre-member-write phase of object lifetime.

Gets or sets the XAML namescope to use for registering names from the XAML writer if <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriterSettings.RegisterNamesOnExternalNamescope*> is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Specific contexts for a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter> might use an external XAML namescope.
WPF Usage Notes In the WPF XAML implementation, XAML writer operations that are initiated by <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkTemplate> specify a separate XAML namescope.
In this WPF scenario, templates should not share a XAML namescope with the root of the XAML page that defines them.
Instead, they should process into a separate, designated XAML namescope.
The XAML namescope to use for registering names.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the XAML writer should ignore (not call) <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertFrom*> implementations on a <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> in type-converter situations.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> class and its <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertFrom%2A> method are part of an overall design for type conversion in the CLR.
In XAML systems, you can typically assume that type-converter input is identifiable by the XAML reader, and for purposes of input, is always a string.
If you set this property to `true`, you enable a mode where this assumption is codified in the XAML object writer behavior.
This mode supports a compatibility requirement for previous versions of WPF XAML.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the XAML writer ignores <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.CanConvertFrom*> implementations; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets a value that determines whether to disable a default feature that runs type conversion on the K component of a <xref:System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary%602> before writing the object graph representation.
For more information about the `K` type conversion feature, see Remarks in <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter>.
if K type conversion for a <xref:System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary%602> object should be disabled.
if performing K type conversion for a <xref:System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary%602> object applies.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether name registration should occur against the specified <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriterSettings.ExternalNameScope*>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if name registration should occur against the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriterSettings.ExternalNameScope*>; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if name registration should occur into the parent XAML namescope.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a preexisting root object for <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter"></xref> operations.

If you set this value, the root object instance is used as an implicit <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter.WriteStartObject%2A> call (with object input that is direct instead of coming from the reader) that precedes the first explicit node-write call by the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter>.

Any error checking, such as verifying the XAML type of the provided root object, is deferred until that implicit <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter.WriteStartObject%2A> call, instead of being checked when you set this settings property.
A preexisting root object for <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter"></xref> operations.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether the XAML writer omits to check for the code path that checks for duplicate properties.
The specified code path checks the currently assigned properties and throws an exception if a duplicate property set of the named ambient property is attempted.
For more information, see <xref:System.Xaml.IAmbientProvider>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the duplicate property check should be omitted; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter"></xref> should omit to call <xref uid="langword_csharp_ProvideValue" name="ProvideValue" href=""></xref> on a markup extension, which is relevant when the markup extension represents the root of an object graph.
This setting is used when the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter> processes the root node (<xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter.WriteEndObject%2A>, or members within the root node).
This property is relevant for template and defer-load scenarios.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter"></xref> should omit to call <xref uid="langword_csharp_ProvideValue" name="ProvideValue" href=""></xref> on a markup extension; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Used in the <xref uid="langword_csharp_BeginInitHandler" name="BeginInitHandler" href=""></xref> in place of the actual <xref uid="langword_csharp_BaseUri" name="BaseUri" href=""></xref>.
Used internally to provide the correct info in the handler, while keeping runtime behavior fully compatible.
A <xref:System.Uri> to be used in place of the actual <xref uid="langword_csharp_BaseUri" name="BaseUri" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the handler to use when the object writer calls into a CLR-implemented <xref uid="langword_csharp_SetValue" name="SetValue" href=""></xref> for dependency properties.
The event handler is based on the generic <xref:System.EventHandler%601> delegate that uses the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlSetValueEventArgs> event data.
A handler implementation that handles this case.
